intro: Ampherephis aristata, commonly known as the arrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its opposite, arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and forest edges. Ampherephis aristata is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to humid climates.
